definition: dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Through education, people can learn many things and get self-cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 通过教育，人们可以学到很多东西，变得有修养。

sentences.english: Confucius as the founder of the Confucianism is inside and outside double in the culture method.
sentences.chinese: 作为儒家创始人的孔子，在修养方法上是仁礼互重。

sentences.english: Personal accomplishment decided the qualities of a person.
sentences.chinese: 个人修养决定了一个人的气质。

sentences.english: The scribe is a class with good ethics and culture in ancient Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 书吏是古代埃及具有良好道德修养的一个阶层。

sentences.english: Dream big heart wide, learn to sea, rivers tolerance is self-cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 梦想大心宽，学会海洋，河流的公差是修养。

sentences.english: Thirdly it is to lead the students to magnificent self-culture.
sentences.chinese: 三是引导中学生进行高尚道德人格的自我修养。
都是流行的和文化修养高的。

sentences.english: Chuang-tzu's theory of man's nature, simplisy, is the base of his theory of cultivating virtues.
sentences.chinese: 庄子的人性素朴论是其德行修养观的基石。

sentences.english: Great Master Yinguang, with huge accomplishment of Confucianism, is the 13th master of the Pure Land Sect.
sentences.chinese: 印光大师是具有丰厚儒学修养的净土宗十三代祖师。

sentences.english: It is common occurrence that now young teachers lack in accomplishment of Marxism-Leninism.
sentences.chinese: 青年教师缺乏马列主义修养是一个比较普遍的现象。

sentences.english: No angry to gossip is our cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 对待流言不怒是我们的大勇和修养。

sentences.english: Money and good manners make the gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 有钱且有修养方为绅士。

sentences.english: Rather than others make you pain, as their own self-cultivation is not enough.
sentences.chinese: 与其说是别人让你痛苦，不如说自己的修养不够。

sentences.english: We spend more money on personal accomplishment and spiritual life.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在消费更多用于个人修养和精神生活上。

sentences.english: Money have nothing to do with moral integrity.
sentences.chinese: 钱和一个人的道德修养是没有关系的。

sentences.english: That spiritual practice begins with what Robinson calls a "theology of self-culture."
sentences.chinese: 这种修行以鲁宾逊称作“自我修养神学”开始。

definition: to train/to educate/to bring up/to nurture/education/culture/upbringing/early conditioning
to cultivate the heart and nurture the character (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation
one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
to take care of (sb's health)/to nurse
lit. to fire pots and smelt metal/fig. to educate
